message.content:
cs.IT, cs.NI, cs.SY, cs.MM, cs.AR 

The paper deals with a distributed receive beamforming architecture that involves signal processing, communication, and networking aspects. Therefore, it could fit into several arXiv CS sub-categories. 

- cs.IT (Information Theory): The paper proposes a novel architecture for cooperative reception that involves information processing and transmission. It also analyzes the performance of the proposed system in terms of signal-to-noise ratio (SNR) scaling and phase synchronization. 
- cs.NI (Networking and Internet Architecture): The paper deals with a distributed system of nodes that communicate and cooperate to achieve a common goal. It also discusses the impact of relaying delay and oscillator drift on the system performance. 
- cs.SY (Systems and Control): The paper proposes a system architecture that involves feedback control and synchronization. It also provides an analytical framework to evaluate the system performance and compares it with experimental results. 
- cs.MM (Multimedia): The paper deals with signal processing and communication aspects of a system that involves multiple nodes and channels. It also discusses the impact of phase noise and oscillator drift on the quality of received signals. 
- cs.AR (Hardware Architecture): The paper presents a prototype implementation of the proposed system on software-defined radios. It also discusses the practical aspects of hardware design and implementation.
